name: Carrot Cake Cookies
description: Gluten-free carrot cake, but make it bite-sized! These cookies have cozy spices, sweet carrot and pineapple, and a moist, chewy texture. The cream cheese icing drizzle is a must to get the full carrot cake effect. And, these count as a serving of veggies, right? Right???
preparation:
1. Preheat oven to 375° F. Line two Sheet Pans with Sheet Pan Liners.  
  2. Coarsely grate carrots. In a large bowl, whisk eggs, oil, and pineapple. Stir in mix and 2 cups grated carrot. (Dough should be scoopable but not runny; if it is too runny, add rolled oats or flour until desired dough consistency is achieved. It should hold its shape when scooped onto pan.)
  3. Using 2 tbsp as a guide, scoop batter and drop onto pans 2" apart. Bake, one sheet at a time, 12 min, or until edges start to brown. Cool on pan 5 min, then carefully transfer to Cooling Racks. 
  4. Meanwhile, using a hand mixer or whisk, beat icing sugar, cream cheese, milk, and vanilla until smooth.  
  5. Using a spoon, drizzle glaze over cooled cookies. 
  6. Store cookies in the refrigerator.
tips: The glaze will thicken as it sits; if needed, add more milk to thin it out to easily drizzle over cookies.
